sn34.1:4.4: One meditator is skilled in samādhi but not in entering it.
sn34.1:4.5: One meditator is not skilled in samādhi but is skilled in entering it.
sn34.1:4.6: One meditator is skilled neither in samādhi nor in entering it.
sn34.1:4.7: One meditator is skilled both in samādhi and in entering it.
sn34.1:4.8: Of these, the meditator skilled in samādhi and in entering it is the foremost, best, leading, highest, and finest of the four.
sn34.1:4.9: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.
sn34.1:4.10: In the same way, the meditator skilled in samādhi and entering it is the foremost, best, leading, highest, and finest of the four.”
